thread.title: Nelson, Rubio split on DeVos nomination
thread.title_full: Nelson, Rubio split on DeVos nomination - Sun Sentinel

author: Steven Lemongello
title: Nelson, Rubio split on DeVos nomination

organizations.name: republican party donald trump buddy dyer

text:
Florida’s two U.S. senators split their votes Tuesday on President Donald Trump ’s controversial nominee for secretary of education, Betsy DeVos – but they also differed on revealing what they heard from constituents.
Bill Nelson , D-Orlando, voted with every member of his party and two Republicans against DeVos, who was ultimately confirmed by a vote from Vice President Mike Pence to break a 50-50 tie. Rubio. R-Miami, voted along with 49 other Senate Republicans to confirm DeVos.
Nelson’s office said they received more than 7,000 calls regarding DeVos’ nomination, almost all of them against it.
Rubio’s office would not release the number of calls, emails or letters received either in favor or against DeVos’ nomination.
Rubio spokesman Matt Wolking said the office has “a longstanding policy of not publicizing this information.”
Rubio’s re-election campaign was one of many in Florida to receive money from DeVos, who gave $5,400 it in 2016. She also gave money to local Democrats, including Orlando Mayor Buddy Dyer and U.S. Rep. Darren Soto.
Who did Betsy DeVos give money to in Florida? »
